Hi guys I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen I'm going to bring

you another treat because it is the beginning
of December and I figured this year I'm going

to throw in a lot more treats, a lot more
fun stuff that you can make with the kids,

that you can give away as edible presents
that take no time or effort, but that are

all delicious, because if it's not good then
I'm not eating it.

And this, I call Christmas popcorn is so good,
I'm going to show you how to make it two different

ways so it's two different flavors, slight
variations but so easy.

So let me run you through the ingredients,
what you'll need is any combination of goodies

that you like, I really like toasted pecans,
I like mini pretzels that I break into pieces,

mini marshmallows with my popcorn and then
you'll need bittersweet chocolate, white chocolate,

I like to use these candy melts, because they
melt really nicely and evenly, then you need

some Christmas sprinkles, and you're also
going to need the zest of a grated clementine

and a little bit of granulated sugar, now
let's make our popcorn first, now I like to

make my own, pop my own, because that's just
what I do.

I like a little bit of sunflower oil in the
bottom of my pan.
Turn this on.

Make sure that your pot is really nice and
big.

Put your popcorn in there, I'm going to put
a lid on this, I don't have it handy but I'm
going to get a lid on this.

I'm going to let this cook until all of my
popcorn has popped, you want to give everything

a shake or stir every once in a while, I prefer
a shake with the lid off, so it doesn't go

all over the place, to prevent any of them
from burning underneath.

So just keep this on medium-low heat and let
them pop until they're all fully popped and

then I'll meet you back here and we'll put
it all together.

and some marshmallows in it.
And I was like 'you know what?'

'I'm not paying $8 for that bag, I'm going

So I've been making it ever since and we call

an indulgence and we only eat it this time

So fantastic, who doesn't love it?
